bug.short_desc: Invalid key "extend" in class "qx.bom.Collection"! The value is undefined/null!

long_desc.thetext:
I am getting the following error in Firefox 3.6 and Chrome 11/12 with the trunk code since quite a while:
Invalid key "extend" in class "qx.bom.Collection"! The value is undefined/null! http://localhost:8080/svn/qooxdoo/framework/source/class/qx/Class.js Line 815
I quess you are on trunk? Did you rerun the generator? If so, did you do a distclean before doing so? Most likely, its something local.

Yes, I always do a distclean after I updated the repository. I first thought it might be a wrong class name, but debugged into it and it happened in the qooxdoo code. The message wasn't always there. It appeared in the past two or three weeks I think.
Could you maybe supply some code to reproduce?
Oh sorry, I forgot to mention, that it happens during the initialization/start-up of the application. So there's no real code sample for this.
Well, could you build a native skeleton app and check if the collection is working? Can't imagine thats that a problem in the current trunk code base because its working her as expected.

Okay, that took me some time. I had an invalid comment in the configuration file, that cause it still to use an old version of the SDK. The warning are gone and I finally seeing some stuff I read about quite a while ago (like _ when building the application). This can be closed now. Sorry about that.
No problem, at least we got the issue solved somehow. :)
